alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 3:46AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Along portions of the Little Popo Agie River, south of Hudson, in Fremont County. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including in Lyons Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 AM MDT, the Little Popo Agie River near Lander was at 5.6 feet. Action stage is 5.0 feet. Flood stage is 5.5 feet. The river is expected to fluctuate between 5.0 feet and 5.6 feet the next few days. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Creek, Tonys Gulch, Twin Creek, Deep Creek, Grant Young Ditch, Little Popo Agie River, Government Draw, Iiams Creek, Popo Agie River and Cherry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyons Valley.
info.instruction: Do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
